newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass falls on earnings warning.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass falls on earnings warning.

text.p: Shares of Spyglass Inc fell 11 percent on Thursday after the company said it would report a larger loss and smaller revenues than analysts had expected for its fiscal first quarter.
Spyglass said it would report a loss of $0.10 to $0.13 a share on revenues of $4 million. According to First Call, analysts on average expected a loss of a penny.
"I actually thought it would be worse," said Mary McCaffrey, an analyst for Alex Brown & Sons, referring to the decline in the stock.

Spyglass said it would receive only the minimum royalty payment from Microsoft Corp for the use of its Internet filter software in the Microsoft Internet Explorer. The software blocks access to objectionable material on the Internet.
Spyglass said the minimum payment is $400,000. Analysts, however, had included expectations of at least $1 million to $2 million in revenues from Microsoft in financial models.
"Spyglass has not cut back on their spending, so it all hit their bottom line," said Abhishek Gami, an analyst for Nesbitt Burns.
Shares of Spyglass traded down one at 11-1/2 in midmornming exchannge trade.
Full Spyglass results are expected to be released on January 22, the company said.
